questions.question:
What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
    const int a = 4;
    float b;
    b = ++a;
    printf("%d, %f", a, ++b);
}

What is the output of the following program?

#define I char
void main() {
    I i = 65;
    printf("sizeof(i) = %d", sizeof(i));
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
    int x = 0, y = 0;
    if (x && y++)
        printf("%d..%d", x++, y);
    printf("%d..%d", x, y);
}

What is the output of the following program?

enum colors { BLACK, BLUE, CYAN };
void main() {
    printf("%d, %d, %d", BLACK, BLUE, CYAN);
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
    char xy = 0;
    for(;xy>0;xy++);
    printf("%d\n", xy);
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
    int *j;
    {
        int i = 1000;
        j = &i;
    }
    printf("%d", *j);
}

questions.question:
In shell script, what is the output of the following program?

counter=1
while [ $counter -le 10 ]
do 
    echo $counter
    ((counter++))
done

options.a: Lists all the numbers from 1 to 10
options.b: Lists all the odd numbers from 1 to 10
options.c: Lists all the even numbers from 1 to 10

options.A: Allocate the program to a specific memory partition which is the smallest available partition able to allocate the whole program.
options.B: Allocate the program to a specific disk partition which is the smallest available partition able to allocate the whole program.
options.C: Allocate the process to a specific memory partition which is the smallest available partition able to allocate the whole process.
options.D: Allocate the process to a specific disk partition which is the smallest available partition able to allocate the whole process.
